intro: Calendula bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer and are often used in herbal medicine and as a natural dye. Calendula bicolor is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects.
